snippet: One of Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s top initiatives took a step forward, as a state panel recommended the approval of resort casinos that are expected to provide thousands of jobs and new tax revenues.
abstract: New York State panel recommends approval of three Las Vegas-style resort casinos--one in Catskills, one near Albany and one in Finger Lakes; move is major step forward in Gov Andrew Cuomo's plan to increase revenue by expanding gambling.

byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and CHARLES V. BAGLI
byline.contributor: Jesse McKinley reported from Albany, and Charles V. Bagli from New York. Bernard Vaughan contributed reporting from Monticello, N.Y.

lead_paragraph: One of Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s top initiatives took a step forward, as a state panel recommended the approval of resort casinos that are expected to provide thousands of jobs and new tax revenues.

headline.main: Board Backs Casinos in the Catskills, Near Albany and in Central New York
headline.print_headline: Board Backs Casinos in the Catskills, Near Albany and in Central New York
